text:
I assume you’re referring to the rendering of the text in the supporting image for the highlighted section?
• Has that text been outlined before exporting, or is it embedded text? If the latter, it could be an antialiasing or other sort of text rendering issue.
• If you’re using something like SVGGO to compress the SVG, check that you’re not setting your accuracy level too low.
Personally, I’d try rasterizing this and serving it as a WebP — the text is going to add enough path complexity to these images that it’ll likely bump the file size and computational load well over that of an equivalent raster.
